lines.text: [after seeing a corpse dressed up like a Christmas tree]
You don't reckon that we keep her up for the twelve days of Christmas, then?
I said, who's there?
[Jack Frost hits Tommy, and enters the house]
Well it ain't fucking Frosty!
Gosh. I only axed you for a smoke.
[after reforming himself in a distorted way]
Look, Ma! I'm a Picasso!
[after Jack has apparently been destroyed]
It's at a time like this, when I think all we can do is turn our eyes up to the heavens and say...
[looks up and realizes Jack is back]
...Oh shit.
Marla, I want you to call around, and get a hold of Jill Metzner. Oh, call the FBI in Denver, too. Some asshole named Manners.
[Sam sees Agent Manners in the office]
Who are you?
I'm the asshole.
Have the MV's been moved?
Motor vehicles?
Have the murder victims been moved yet?
No, uh, Jake and Sally Metzner have not been moved yet.
Fine. First take me to the crime scene. 'Scuse me, Jake and Sally's place. If everything checks out as I think it will, I'll have a task force in here by midnight.
Does this mean this case is being taken out of my hands?
It was never in them, Sheriff.
[Sam has frightened Stone with a warning shot]
Do something!
Like what? Teach him how to shoot better?
[Sam looks at one of Jack Frost's letters]
I thought you destroyed those.
I wish it was that easy.
Sam, he's gone, and he can't come back. The only place he exists now is in here.
[Anne touches Sam's head and kisses him]
Tommy, no. Don't put cold water in. Now it's freezing.
[the bath water transforms into Jack Frost]
[Jack Frost has killed Jill]
Looks like Christmas came a little early this year. Well, I hope it was good for you honey. Oh, I must remember to send flowers.
What the hell's eating him?
I bet you it ain't his girlfriend.
Come and get me when you're ready.
Yes! If I was any more ready, I'd explode.

[on seeing a freshly ran bath of water]
Thank you, Tommy!
[Cuts to Tommy's corpse, which seems to be comically nodding in response]
Is it cold in here or is it just me?

[attacking Sam with an icicle]
Listen, I got a point I'd like to make!

That's right, Sheriff! You take a good, long look at this face! 'Cuz the next time you see it, it's gonna tear your world apart! I'll find a way! I'll tear your town apart! I'll kill your family! I'll kill you! You're dead! You hear me? Dead!
We know it's you, Jack.
Bah humbug.
Look, I just saw something that doesn't belong in this world, and it's out there killing my friends. Now, tell me what it is!
Jack Frost.
No, Jack Frost died.
Jack Frost changed.
Changed?
Look, I need everybody here to work with me on this, alright? I need you to stay calm. I need you to trust these people.
Why in hell should we trust these guys?
Because we might just be your only hope.
That's right!
What's the difference between snowmen and snow women?
Tom...
No, really. What's the difference.

[leaving]
I'll see you, Tommy.
Snowballs. Did you get it, Mr. T? Snowballs.
So, you reckon you're about ready to step out to lunch with me then?
Do I look ready?
Sure do to me.
[Marla sprays hair spray at him]
Luckily for you, Joe, the power to cloud men's minds is a responsibility I take very seriously.
Fucker's a snowman!
Say, pal, how about a smoke?
Say, Frost, why don't you shut the hell up?
[the guard smokes a cigarette and blows smoke at Jack Frost, who sniffs it]
Filtered.
What the hell are you?
The world's most pissed-off snow cone!
[Jack's head flying through the air]
I can see your house from up here!

[after being hit by a truck]
Somebody get the number of that truck!
[Billy is decapitated by a sled]
I didn't do it.
[Sam has just had a conversation with Agent Manners, whom he had called an "asshole"]
You were right the first time, Sam - 'asshole!'

[surviving a motor vehicle accident]
Looks like Deep Fried Jack's off the menu for tonight, huh?
Jesus Christ.
Did you say 'it', Doc?
I beg your pardon?
You said 'it', instead of 'he' or 'she'.
That's just a figure of speech, Sam. Who- whoever did this is an animal... metaphorically.
What if he doesn't show?
Jack was never one to miss a party.
[Sam shoves oatmeal at Jack Frost, causing him to burn]
Oatmeal is making him burn. Wait. What did you put in those oats?
Sorry.
No. It's a good thing that you did.
I didn't want you to get cold.
What did you put in the oats?
Anti-freeze.
[Sam smiles and hugs Ryan]
[Sam has just been misinformed about the status of Jack Frost]
It's over.
It's starting.
Your place or mine?
Yours.
Come on.
Come on, shoot it!
Those are not your orders.
Somebody remember to put out the cat.
[Agent Manners fires his gun at Jack Frost, causing an explosion]
She's only talking back to you because she's upset.
Sally, when I want philosophy, I'll turn on "Oprah."
Don't eat yellow snow!
Agent Manners.
FBI?
Sure. Why not?
We hadn't even tested the acid on an amoeba, let alone a human cell. This is a disaster.
Disaster? You got to learn to look on the bright side of things.
The bright side?
Sure. At least you know it works. It's just a shame that your guinea pig had to be a homicidal maniac like Jack Frost, who I now have to put back... in a test tube.

[driving through a snowstorm]
That murdering bastard Jack Frost in there is one lucky son of a bitch.
Lucky? He's being executed in thirty minutes.
Yeah, but at least he doesn't have to drive back through this crap.
Deep fried Jack served at midnight!
I heard about Jack Frost. End of an era.
End of a nightmare.

[muttering to his snowman puppet]
I hope he breaks his face.
What did you say?
Nothing.
Nobody says nothing behind my back.
What do you want us to do, Stone? Wait until spring and see if he melts?
Don't you think we ought to put the tree lights on?
Your son is in cold five hours. You want festivities?
I was only...
Yeah, well don't.

[to Paul]
Ho ho ho. And what's your name little boy?
